Quotes: I was losing interest in politics, when the repeal of the Missouri Compromise aroused me again. What I have done since then is pretty well known.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: All great deeds and all great thoughts have a ridiculous beginning. Great works are often born on a street corner or in a restaurant's revolving door.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: The end of labor is to gain leisure.
Author: Aristotel

Quotes: Necessity never made a good bargain.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: The first rule of business is: Do other men for they would do you.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: If you pursue good with labor, the labor passes away but the good remains;if you pursue evil with pleasure, the pleasure passes away and the evil remains.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Learning without thought is labor lost;thought without learning is perilous.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: Small projects need much more help than great.
Author: Dante Alighieri

Quotes: What are people going to do? Fire me? I've been fired before. Not book me? I've been out of work before. I don't care.
Author: Joan Rivers

Quotes: I have no dress except the one I wear every day. If you are going to be kind enough to give me one, please let it be practical and dark so that I can put it on afterwards to go to the laboratory.
Author: Marie Curie

Quotes: A worker may be the hammer's master, but the hammer still prevails. A tool knows exactly how it is meant to be handled, while the user of the tool can only have an approximate idea.
Author: Milan Kundera

Quotes: Without the meditative background that is criticism, works become isolated gestures, historical accidents, soon forgotten.
Author: Milan Kundera

Quotes: Give me a museum and I'll fill it.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: All things will be produced in superior quantity and quality, and with greater ease, when each man works at a single occupation, in accordance with his natural gifts, and at the right moment, without meddling with anything else.
Author: Plato

Quotes: It is no good getting furious if you get stuck. What I do is keep thinking about the problem but work on something else. Sometimes it is years before I see the way forward. In the case of information loss and black holes, it was 29 years.
Author: Stephen Hawking

Quotes: All things are difficult before they are easy.
Author: Thomas Fuller

Quotes: Thought is the labor of the intellect, reverie is its pleasure.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: A man is not idle because he is absorbed in thought. There is a visible labor and there is an invisible labor.
Author: Victor Hugo
